episodeTitle: The Truth Behind Her Betrayal! Robin's Sorrowful Decision!
description: Iceburg reveals to Nami the truth behind Robin's betrayal: she surrendered herself to the World Government to protect the Straw Hats from a Buster Call. Meanwhile, Chopper heroically rescues Paulie and Iceburg from a burning building, and the Going Merry is set adrift by the Galley-La foremen.

events.title: Chopper's Heroic Rescue
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper escapes the burning Galley-La Company building with both Paulie and Iceburg on his back, saving their lives. After placing them safely outside, Chopper collapses from exhaustion and smoke inhalation.
events.significance: This heroic act earns Chopper the respect and gratitude of the Water 7 citizens, who had previously been hostile to the Straw Hats. It demonstrates Chopper's strength and dedication to helping others, even those who had accused his crew.

events.title: Iceburg Reveals Robin's True Motives to Nami
events.description: After waking up, Iceburg apologizes to Nami for falsely accusing the Straw Hats and reveals the truth: Robin didn't betray them. She surrendered herself to CP9 to ensure the crew could escape Water 7 safely, agreeing to help the World Government in exchange for their lives.
events.significance: This is the pivotal revelation that explains Robin's apparent betrayal and sets up the Enies Lobby rescue arc. It shows Robin's willingness to sacrifice herself for her nakama, mirroring her tragic past of being alone and hunted.

quotes.text: Robin wanted the Straw Hats, excluding herself, to leave the island safely. To do so, she turned herself in to the government to help them recover the blueprints and then to be executed.
quotes.speaker: Iceburg
quotes.context: Iceburg explaining Robin's sacrifice to Nami

events.title: Buster Call Threat Revealed
events.description: Through flashback, it's revealed that CP9 threatened Robin with a Buster Call - an emergency military action that summons five Vice Admirals and ten battleships. Admiral Aokiji granted CP9 the authority to initiate this devastating attack if Robin didn't cooperate.
events.significance: This reveals the terrifying power of a Buster Call and explains why Robin, who survived one at Ohara as a child, immediately surrendered to protect her crew. It establishes the massive stakes and military might of the World Government.

quotes.text: A Buster Call is an emergency action that summons five Vice Admirals and ten battleships to the same location. Admiral Aokiji gave CP9 the right to make the call.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin explaining the threat to Iceburg in flashback

events.title: Robin's Conditions from CP9 Revealed
events.description: In flashback, Robin confronts Iceburg and explains that CP9 gave her two conditions: first, to pin Iceburg's assassination on the Straw Hats and leave the crew; second, to turn herself over to the World Government and follow their every word, ultimately leading to her execution.
events.significance: This reveals the impossible choice Robin faced and explains all her actions during the Water 7 arc. It shows the depth of her sacrifice and her willingness to die to protect the only people who ever truly accepted her.

quotes.text: I am only studying the Poneglyphs to learn more of the history of the world. I don't care about the ancient weapon.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin defending her motivations to Iceburg

quotes.text: You know nothing of Ohara! You know nothing of how the World Government has warped my life!
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin's angry response to Iceburg's judgment

events.title: Nami Decides to Rescue Robin
events.description: After learning the truth from Iceburg, Nami rushes to tell Chopper so they can find the rest of the crew and save Robin. This marks the beginning of the Straw Hats' determination to rescue their nakama no matter what.
events.significance: This is the emotional turning point where the Straw Hats shift from confusion and anger to unified determination to save Robin, setting the stage for the Enies Lobby assault.

events.title: Going Merry Set Adrift
events.description: The Galley-La foremen release the Going Merry, allowing it to drift out to sea where it will eventually be destroyed. This is done as a form of mercy, as the ship is beyond repair and cannot sail.
events.significance: This represents the beginning of the end for the Going Merry, the Straw Hats' beloved first ship. It foreshadows the emotional farewell that will come later and symbolizes the crew's transition to a new phase of their journey.

events.title: Franky Recognizes Spandam's Voice
events.description: At his hideout, Franky finally recognizes the voice of the CP9 leader as belonging to Spandam, someone from his past connected to the tragedy involving Tom. This recognition fills him with rage and determination.
events.significance: This connects Franky's backstory to the current CP9 plot and establishes his personal stake in the conflict. It foreshadows the revelation of Spandam's role in Tom's death and Franky's eventual alliance with the Straw Hats.

events.title: CP9 Captures Franky
events.description: Rob Lucci leads the CP9 agents to capture Franky. When Franky's followers try to intervene, Blueno uses his Devil Fruit power to restrain them. Usopp courageously demands that CP9 release Franky.
events.significance: This shows CP9's ruthless efficiency and sets up Franky's capture alongside Robin. Usopp's brave stand despite being outmatched demonstrates his growth and loyalty, even after leaving the crew.

events.title: Sanji Locates Robin at the Train Station
events.description: Sanji successfully tracks Robin to the Sea Train station, where CP9 is preparing to take her to Enies Lobby. This discovery gives the Straw Hats a chance to intercept the transport.
events.significance: This is a crucial strategic development that allows the Straw Hats to plan their rescue attempt. It shows Sanji's determination and tracking skills, and sets up the dramatic confrontation at the station.

themes.description: Robin's willingness to sacrifice her life and freedom to protect her crewmates demonstrates the ultimate expression of love and loyalty. Her decision mirrors her tragic past and shows how much the Straw Hats mean to her.
themes.symbolism: Robin's surrender symbolizes her breaking pattern of running away and instead choosing to face danger head-on to protect others.

themes.description: Robin's trauma from the Ohara Buster Call drives her decision to surrender when CP9 threatens another Buster Call. Her past continues to haunt her and influence her present choices.
themes.symbolism: The threat of a Buster Call represents how the World Government's past atrocities continue to control and terrorize survivors.

themes.description: The revelation of Robin's true motives transforms the Straw Hats' perception from betrayal to understanding. The truth sets them on a path to rescue their nakama.
themes.symbolism: Iceburg's revelation acts as a light in the darkness, dispelling misunderstanding and uniting the crew in purpose.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's motivations are fully revealed, showing her transformation from a lone survivor to someone willing to sacrifice everything for her nakama. Her confrontation with Iceburg reveals her anger at how the World Government has controlled her life.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several flashback sequences showing Robin's confrontation with Iceburg, providing more emotional depth and dialogue.
Added scenes of Chopper's rescue showing more detail of the burning building and the citizens' reactions.

trivia.fact: Episode 251 aired as part of a one-hour special together with Episode 250 in Japan.
The ending theme 'Dear Friends' by TRIPLANE is dedicated to the Going Merry and also plays during the ship's funeral in Episode 312.
This episode covers manga chapters 358-359, which are crucial chapters in the Water 7 arc that shift the story from mystery to rescue mission.
The episode's TV rating in Japan was 9.8%, ranking 6th among all One Piece episodes at the time.
